p: Several methods have been proposed to forecast dengue incidence. Some of these methods were developed in the context of the Dengue Forecasting Project [ 8]. One class of methods uses deterministic differential equations and primarily focuses on dengue transmission [ 9]. Such methods are reviewed in [ 10]. Another class of models follows a data-driven approach and uses techniques such as machine learning [ 11, 12]. Other examples in this class include seasonal autoregressive models that incorporate weather information [ 13â€“ 19] and hybrid models [ 20].
